Life-threatening if pH < 7.10 or bicarbonaemia < 8 mmol/L: reduced cardiac and tissue output, dyspnoea, catecholamine resistance, ventricular arrhythmias, inhibition of cellular metabolism and coma.

question.title: What is a life-threatening consequence of severe acidosis?
question.description: A critical condition that requires immediate attention

option_a.title: pH < 6.80 or bicarbonaemia < 7 mmol/L
option_a.description: A critical condition that may lead to serious complications

option_b.title: pH < 7.10 or bicarbonaemia < 8 mmol/L
option_b.description: A life-threatening condition that requires immediate treatment

option_c.title: pH < 6.50 or bicarbonaemia < 10 mmol/L
option_c.description: A severe condition that may lead to organ failure

option_d.title: pH < 7.20 or bicarbonaemia < 6 mmol/L
option_d.description: A critical condition that requires close monitoring
